verbs.label: Pier: Bench
verbs.description: The pier stretches into the sea, offering an escape from the bustling tavern nearby. A wooden bench sits at its end. To one side, a small boat is tied to weathered post.

slot.label: Character/Event
slot.description: Being on the pier requires at least one main character.

verbs.label: Talk
verbs.description: Two characters can talk about life, gossip, or the inevitability of death.

slot.label: Character
slot.description: There must be at least one main character among the two.

verbs.label: Fort: Main Hall
verbs.description: The main hall is decorated with tapestries and ornaments from different origins. A deer head hangs above the fireplace. One can always find a piece of memory here.

slot.label: Character/Event
slot.description: Exploring the Fort Main Hall requires at least one main character.

verbs.label: Fort: Dining Room
verbs.description: The dining room is where the baron used to host banquets. Besides the bread on the long table, one can always find a piece of memory here.

slot.label: Character
slot.description: Exploring the Fort Dining Room requires at least one main character.

verbs.label: Fort: Tower
verbs.description: The tower provides a nice view. On a clear day, one can see both the sea and the monastery from here.

slot.label: Character/Event
slot.description: Exploring the Fort Tower requires at least one main character.

verbs.label: Fort: Training Yard
verbs.description: The training yard is a large dirt ground within the fort yard. It has a weapon rack, and the stable is nearby.

slot.label: Character
slot.description: Exploring the Fort Training Yard requires at least one main character.

verbs.label: Tavern: Keeper's Seat
verbs.description: The seat belongs to the tavern's current keeper. It might be the scribe, or even the minstrel, if the taverner is too drunk.

slot.label: Character
slot.description: Keeping the tavern in order requires at least one person.

verbs.label: Tavern: Owners' Room - Desk
verbs.description: The private room is where the taverner and the scribe reside. It has a bed, a desk, a roof that was recently repaired, and a vault containing all their money.

slot.label: Character
slot.description: Using the desk requires at least one person.

verbs.label: Tavern: Juniper's Seat
verbs.description: A pile of golden hay rests in a quiet corner of the tavern. It is Juniper's usual seat when she is not wandering in the kitchen.

slot.label: Cat
slot.description: Petting the cat requires at least one cat nearby.

slot.label: Character/Event
slot.description: Going to the Kitchen requires at least one person.

verbs.label: Market
verbs.description: The market is a lively place filled with mechants of fish, sheep, trinkets, and many others. One can also find selling indulgences.

slot.label: Character
slot.description: Buying at the market requires at least one person.

verbs.label: Monastery East Tower: Workstation
verbs.description: The workstation was given to the doctor by the prior. The doctor does alchemy experiments and blend herbs here. An oven, a balance, a mortar, and many crystal vials scattered around it.

slot.label: Character
slot.description: Using the workstation requires at least one person.

verbs.label: Monastery: Garden
verbs.description: The garden in the monastery grows flowers and trees, as well as medicinal herbs.

slot.label: Character
slot.description: Going to the garden requires at least one person.

verbs.label: Monastery: Bishop's (Temporary) Room
verbs.description: This dark and humid room is the bishop's temporary bedroom in the monastery. It has a bed, a closet, a desk, and a large window covered by thick drapes of curtains.

slot.label: Character/Event
slot.description: Going to Bishop's Room requires at least one person.

verbs.label: Monastery: Prior's Room
verbs.description: The prior's room serves not only as their bedroom, but also as a place for small meetings. The room has a round table with chairs, a desk, a map of the town, and a small altar.

slot.label: Character/Event
slot.description: Going to Prior's Room requires at least one person.

verbs.label: Village: Vicar's Work
verbs.description: One could quote Scripture here. However, the Vicar's work is often more down-to-earth. They reach villagers' lives via rites and sacraments.

slot.label: Character/Event
slot.description: Going to the Village requires at least one person.
